fields.description:
SWF files published on a website repository like username.bitbucket.org cannot be loaded by Flash Player when they are embeded in an HTML wrapper (i.e using embed tag and swfobject) because they are served with header Content-Disposition:attachment

These repositories are those described by the following link : [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing+a+Website+on+Bitbucket|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing%2Ba%2BWebsite%2Bon%2BBitbucket]

Flash Player cannot load SWF when Content-Disposition is attachment : [http://www.adobe.com/devnet/flashplayer/articles/fplayer10_security_changes.html#head32|http://www.adobe.com/devnet/flashplayer/articles/fplayer10_security_changes.html#head32]

*If possible* : Please set Content-Disposition:inline for SWF files (*Only for those kind of repositories i.e published website on Bitbucket*)

Other people have the same problem but for other file types (PDF) : [https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5699/|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/5699/]
fields.summary: SWF files should be served with Content-Disposition:inline to be loaded by Flash Player

fields.description:
Creating a new branch re-parses all commits from the first commit and wreaks havoc on issue tickets.

The proper solution is either: (or both, ie configurable, but should have sane defaults)

# Only parse the main branch (e.g. "master" as configured)
# Only parse new commits (not already existing in the repository). Existing commits should not be reparsed.

Commit links should also be configurable, so it can be disabled/enabled at will.

fields.description:
h1. Unlisted Repository
h2. What?
Provide the ability to make a repository as unlisted.  It would function just like an unlisted youtube video;\\
[https://support.google.com/youtube/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=181547|https://support.google.com/youtube/bin/answer.py%3Fhl%3Den%26answer%3D181547]

h2. Why?
An unlisted repository would benefit this site by allowing developers to share their code to a wider, yet known and trusted audience.  There exists a space between "This code is so good, I must share it with the word!" and "This code is so private I must only share it with those already invested in it." (and therefore willing to register for an account).

Additionally, frictionless sharing will help drive other developers (the ones that were brought to the site by an unlisted share) to explore and become familiar with the Bitbucket site, and potentially convert them to registered users.
fields.summary: Unlisted Repository (BB-7459)

We end up having to abandon the PR and all tracking/commenting info and doing a new one; which is a pain in the arse.
fields.summary: Pull requests fail to load after git reclaims objects required for the PRs diffs (BB-7238)

fields.summary: Just signed up to your system... and got this bug????

fields.description:
See for example,

http://git.elopez.com.ar/

"Fork of linux" is a 404 link.
fields.summary: "Fork of X" link on account overview when using a custom domain is broken

fields.description:
Please add support for patch files, and not just diffs when viewing a commit. Patch files can be downloaded and passed to 'git am' to import them into our own repository, without having to add a remote and fetch all of it to cherry pick.

Bitbucket:

* diff: https://bitbucket.org/mirror/linux/commits/836dc9e3fbbab0c30aa6e664417225f5c1fb1c39/raw/
* patch: not supported.

Github:

* diff: https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/836dc9e3fbbab0c30aa6e664417225f5c1fb1c39.diff
* patch: https://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/836dc9e3fbbab0c30aa6e664417225f5c1fb1c39.patch
fields.summary: Add support for patch files (BB-7460)

fields.description:
I have the following project structure:

{code}
doc/
    getting_started.md
    ...
readme.md
{code}

In my readme.md file, I link to the getting_started.md document like so:

{code}
[Get started](doc/getting_started.md)
{code}

When viewing the readme.md file in the source tab this link 404's (it points to ../project/doc/contributing.md)

But when I click on the readme.md file and view it, the link works (correctly points to ../project/src/31...8e/doc/contributing.md)

There is a (possibly?) subtly different problem for relative links in sub-folders.  Given the project structure of:

{code}
doc/
    style/
        markdown.md
    readme.md
top_level_readme.md
{code}

In the readme.md file, if I have a link to style/markdown.md as follows:

{code}
[Markdown Style Guide](style/markdown.md)
{code}

It will break in a similar manner to the above (50% of the time), but with the following urls:

Overview page links to: ../project/src/31...8e/style/markdown.md

While viewing readme.md links to: ../project/src/31...8e/doc/style/markdown.md
fields.summary: Relative urls in readme.md files only work half the time. (BB-7521)

fields.description: When developers use tab for indentation, they mainly do that to have the indent size in their IDEs adjustable (to configure it as one prefers). Usually people use 2 or 4 spaces for tabs in the editor. Currently BitBucket converts tabs to 8 spaces to show them in its Web UI. It does not look convenient, especially when you have a couple of nested blocks in your code. It would be much better to have 4 spaces for tabs on the Web, not 8 (too much for indentation).
fields.summary: Change tab size from 8 to 4 spaces in the Web UI (BB-7457)

fields.description:
Sorting by title produces same result as sorting by create date, because issue number is prefixed. This does not make much sense because:

* creating custom prefixes (e.g. due date) will not be taken into consideration when sorting
* as implemented this functionality is duplicate of sorting by create date
* there is no way to control issue number. When creating issue, title is - well title, not hash + issuenumber + title.
fields.summary: Sorting issues by title is broken (BB-7502)

fields.description: Please enable support for ECDSA SSH keys. They have been part of OpenSSH since 5.7 (January 2011, more than two years ago), so if you're running an older version than this, maybe it's due for an upgrade anyway. :)
fields.summary: Supporting ECDSA SSH keys

fields.description:
*When accessing https://bitbucket.org/georgeyord/baseapp I'm getting the following:*

Something went wrong.

You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.\\
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
b804dd35bb3746698151bbd439dd671a$25ed0bd4b5e93acb03b84751f18505d2\\
You can also visit our status page.

*What can i do to be able to view again my repo?*
fields.summary: Can't access a private repo

fields.description:
Hi, I am trying to push a commit I made to my bitbucket repo and am getting an error:

error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit

! [remote rejected] master -> master (n/a (unpacker error))\\
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://bitbucket.org/xxxx/xxxxx.git'

Also, when trying to view that particular repo, i get a website error 500 with this code:

ab4405052e4b45eeba5d22befe6b3125$8b926289c561af04a5a18eff3c77d7ed

I was able to push just a few hours ago...

Thanks!
fields.summary: Can't push to repository

fields.description:
Hello, most likely I have something configured incorrectly but I was supprised when someone was able to push directly to the repo that I maintain.

Here is our discussion.

https://bitbucket.org/cleemesser/django-wsgiserver/issue/4/mediahandler-security-of-paths
fields.summary: default security on repo allows push from random user?

fields.description:
The example below creates the right css tag, unfortunately it doesn't align the image.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Adding+Images+to+a+Wiki+Page
fields.summary: Image alignment with reST wiki (BB-7500)

fields.description:
Hi,

I use bitbucket to store and share my latex source files. I would like to offer a pdf readable version along with the latex files, so that my users don't have to latex the source before they can view the result. Is there any way to include a pdf file in a repository, but such that it is not subject to version control? As the latex files them selves are under version control, it suffices to show/store just the latest pdf.
fields.summary: latex and pdf

fields.description:
On page https://bitbucket.org/support, I click on the link to the Blog, which is https.  This seams wrong because of two reasons.

# The certificate in use is _wrong_ because it is for *wpengine.com*.
# SSL isn't needed for the blog.  It switches to HTTP anyway
fields.summary: Link and/or site error

fields.description: Starting some time Feb 7th the commit notifications started being sent with a return address of "commits-*reply*" instead of "commits-*noreply*".  This messes up existing email filters.  Since the change is pointless and the new address makes no sense, I don't see how it was done on purpose.  If you really do intend on changing your reply address, wouldn't it be helpful to give some kind of notice first?
fields.summary: Commit notification sending from "wrong" address

fields.description:
If you add bulleted list to issue description, it results in raw text, e.g:

{code}
My list:
* first
* second
{code}

Is printed like

My list:

* first
* second
fields.summary: Bulleted list is not supported in issues.

fields.description: I have a README.md file in the root of one of my repositories. At the bottom of the document, I include a copyright notice which uses the © (ampersand copy semicolon) HTML entity. This doesn't get converted to the © (circle-C) symbol by your Markdown processor; it shows up in the converted document at © (ampersand copy semicolon). This should be converted as stated in the [Markdown specification|http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax#autoescape].
fields.summary: Conversion of README Markdown to HTML misses copyright symbol.

fields.description:
On new issue creation process it is a good idea to assign default user in case of only one user on project.\\
E.g., if one developer only involved in project when this developer only might be assigned to newly created issue. So he must be assigned by default to the newly created issue.
fields.summary: Default assignee on new issue creation

fields.description: A commit shows up in the history, but all the links are broken and the files are not in the repository?  My local code thinks everything is committed.  Not sure what to do now.

fields.description: After transferring a git repo to a team that I am in, the SSH URI changed to the new owner, but the HTTPS URL continues to use my username.
fields.summary: HTTPS URL did not change after a transfer
